    • Method Detail

      • search

        public Node search(es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.Problem problem,
          es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.State initialState)
        Carries out a search process from the initial state to the final state of the given problem. This method is defined according to the second version of the basic search algorithm which checks for repeated states (refer to the last algorithm studied in chapter 3).
        Specified by:
        search in class SearchMethod
        Parameters:
        problem - Problem to be solved by a search method.
        initialState - Problem's initial state.
        Returns:
        Node
        • If a solution is found, Node contains the problem's final state
        • If the problem can't be solved, Node contains null.

      • expand

        protected java.util.List<Node> expand(Node node,
                          es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.Problem problem,
                          java.util.List<es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.State> generatedStates,
                          java.util.List<es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.State> expandedStates)
        Expands the node's state thereby generating a list of successor nodes. Expansion takes place by invoking the problem's operators apply() method on the node's state.
        Overrides:
        expand in class SearchMethod
        Parameters:
        node - node whose state is to be expanded.
        problem - problem to solve
        generatedStates - List states generated along the search process.
        expandedStates - List states expanded along the search process.
        Returns:
        List containing the successor nodes.
